{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Golgi tendon organ (GTO) is a proprioceptive sensory receptor organ that senses changes in muscle tension. It lies at the origins and insertion of skeletal muscle fibers into the tendons of skeletal muscle. The number of muscle fibers attached to one Golgi tendon organ can vary, but it's typically in the range of 10 to 15.", "answer_choice": "C. 15-Oct"}
